head.supplied: ¶ The proposed recipients of the 9th Decade ¶ are largely but not entirely the same as those of the eighth, as about one fifth of the entries in the present list are new; death carries off annually ...

div.p: P84/809, unit 43, VPRS 1163/P1 inward correspondence files, VA 1123 Premier, Public Record Office, Victoria.

First registered in the Chief Secretary's Department as A84/2721, then forwarded to the Premier.
The proposed recipients of the 9th Decade
i.e. of M's Eucalyptographia; see B83.13.07. are largely but not entirely the same as those of the eighth, as about one fifth of the entries in the present list are new; death carries off annually some correspondents; new ones and new Societies arise; some get into arrear with their own sendings; some are interested more in the species of one decade than those of others; and one hundred copies would not suffice to supply all those, who might perhaps be entitled for consideration. I have therefore used my best discretion each time in the distribution, when a part of the work appeared. — As the supplement of the "Census of Australian plants"
B84.13.16. consists only of half a sheet of print and is therefore not costly, perhaps the hon. the Premier will kindly allow that also "on behalf of the Vict. Government" a copy goes with each of the 9th Decade.
See also M to G. Berry, 21 March 1884.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller.
On 25 April 1884 the Secretary to the Premier, E. Thomas, responded: 'Approved by the Premier and returned to the Under Secretary'. M was duly informed of the Premier's decision and on 29 April returned the file 'with best thanks for approval'.
